page.title: 18HOLYWELL'S INNER-RING ROAD
page.content: 1985 appears to be Holywell's "year of the roads."{An inner-ring road}costing Â£1 million was begun in March after many years of debate. Tradespeople felt that trade would be adversely affected; others that the provision of the A55 Holywell By-pass would negate the need for this road but Delyn B.C. aim to{regenerate Holywell}as a shopping and tourist centre. The new road runs north of the main shopping area of High St and Tower Gdns which will be{pedestrianised.}The twin hazards of Cross St and Victoria Sq at either end of the High St will be overcome. Work by the contractors, (McFadden's), has resulted in the demolition of old property, (eg. Bank Place) and the collapse of old sewers. Car parking has also been temporarily reduced. Due to these problems many regard Holywell as a disaster area!
